Articles.Content:
Hello all,

As most of you may have already done, I\'ve downloaded quite a few plugins/parts for KSP. Initial load time is within the Kerbal 'Snore' Zone (that area of time when Bill and Bob fall asleep during a mission, and Jeb has to noogy them to get them awake). Which got me to wondering ... is there a mod manager of any sort, which will increase the load time of KSP, depending on what you want to do when you load up? If not, I have enough basic programming knowledge to do something similar (so long as all the mods have a prefix code ... hoping most of the mod/part developers have done so, and so far, I think they have).

Just curious if there\'s something like this already, so I don\'t waste my limited time trying to develop something similar.

Thanks!

Wired2theNet

Have a look at GME; http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=997.0

I use it, its pretty swell; can manage not only Parts folders, but Ships and Plugins as well. Keeps backups of changed files so it can revert, and warns you if 2 mods are changing the same file (version mismatch)
